Class DrawingEllipse

  • java.lang.Object
    • DrawingObject
      • DrawingEllipse

  • public class DrawingEllipse
extends DrawingObject
    Author:
    Eric Sekyere A DrawingEllipse is an extension of the DrawingObject abstract class. It is used to store the details pertaining to an ellipse for the drawing program.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DrawingEllipse(int x1, int y1, int x2, int y2)
      This constructs a new DrawingEllipse object.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void drawObject(java.awt.Graphics2D g2)
      This function draws the ellipse using the given Graphics2D context.
      java.awt.Rectangle getBoundingBox()
      This function returns a Bounding Box.
      void resizeObject(int x1, int y1, int x2, int y2)
      This resizes a DrawingEllipse object.
      boolean wasClicked(int px, int py)
      This function determines whether the given point (px, py), where the user has clicked, hits the edge of this ellipse.

      • Methods inherited from class DrawingObject

        clickHitEllipse, clickHitLine

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Detail

      • DrawingEllipse

        public DrawingEllipse(int x1,
                      int y1,
                      int x2,
                      int y2)
        This constructs a new DrawingEllipse object. The ellipse is defined by its bounding box coordinates, (x1, y1) and (x2, y2).
        Parameters:
        x1 - x point for the first coordinate of the bounding box
        y1 - y point for the first coordinate of the bounding box
        x2 - x point for the second coordinate of the bounding box
        y2 - y point for the second coordinate of the bounding box

    • Method Detail

      • resizeObject

        public void resizeObject(int x1,
                         int y1,
                         int x2,
                         int y2)
        This resizes a DrawingEllipse object. The two bounding box coordinates, (x1, y1) and (x2, y2), that define the ellipse are updated.
        Specified by:
        resizeObject in class DrawingObject
        Parameters:
        x1 - x point for initial coordinate
        y1 - y point for initial coordinate
        x2 - x point for final coordinate
        y2 - y point for final coordinate

      • wasClicked

        public boolean wasClicked(int px,
                          int py)
        This function determines whether the given point (px, py), where the user has clicked, hits the edge of this ellipse.
        Specified by:
        wasClicked in class DrawingObject
        Parameters:
        px - x coordinate of provided point
        py - y coordinate of provided point
        Returns:
        true if provided coordinate hits any part of the object else false

      • getBoundingBox

        public java.awt.Rectangle getBoundingBox()
        This function returns a Bounding Box. A bounding box is the smallest rectangle that contains the ellipse.
        Specified by:
        getBoundingBox in class DrawingObject
        Returns:
        a rectangle object as a bounding box

      • drawObject

        public void drawObject(java.awt.Graphics2D g2)
        This function draws the ellipse using the given Graphics2D context.
        Specified by:
        drawObject in class DrawingObject
        Parameters:
        g2 - A graphics2D object
